direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods create binding responses but with different sets of attributes and compliance standards (3489 vs. 5389).
Both methods handle error scenarios and create responses with error attributes.
Both methods create responses related to network resource allocation and mapping addresses.
The createBindingResponse method often depends on requests created by createBindingRequest, indicating a strong functional dependency.
Both methods involve creating messages with specific types and attributes, sharing similar control flows and exception handling.
